Posts.Title: biopsy is ordered but I don't know when yet hoping42 hoping42

Posts.Content: hoping42 wrote: Hello everyone.  I first of all want to thank those that responded to me on another thread.  Talking with those that truly understand is helpful.  After several magnified images and an ultrasound, a needle biopsy is the next step.  Unfortunately, don't know when yet due to Doctor A needing to talk to Doctor B to schedule.  They said it will be an ultrasound guided biopsy.  Thankfully they were not able to find a mass on magnified mammogram film or by the ultrasound.  They are sending me because of these microcalcifications that weren't there in my last 4 mammograms. I won't lie, I am so very scared, as I know you can relate!!!  If you can muster any other encouraging words and support, I would so appreciate it.  Thanks again for being there---just wish different reasons.  (:  I am all consumed, even though I am trying not to think about this every second. Posts.Title: B9 results!!!! scar3d2death GramM

Posts.Content: hoping42 wrote: So, I was told that I should know my results in "48 hours"--not guaranteed, but still....Didn't get the results yesterday so even though I was painstakingly nervous out of my mind-I kept calling the radiologist's offiice to see if they had the report and they told me that they would call to see the status.  So....I get a phone call back saying that it is in process.  No guarantee if I would get back today even.  My husband (LOVE him) said this is enough and called again for me.  This time the manager of the place (not the doctor, tech or receptionist) said that he would call the lab again to see what the status was and that he would call back.  He did call back to tell me that it was still in process...blah....blah....blah and that they would get back to me when they had results.  He said for me not to jump to conclusions good or bad that this is taking so long.  What do you guys think?  I have hardly maintained to get though this week let alone a weekend.  I am praying and hoping for benign results.  This is so awful!  I wish they hadn't said anything about 48 hours if there was a chance it would be much longer.  Oh, my goodness......I am scared out of my mind.  Thank you for being here for me! Posts.Title: I am so FRUSTRATED hoping42 JerzeeGurl43012

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 06:47PM hoping42 wrote: Much love to all of you and thank you! Melanie, yes...I love to read. The kids were super today.  We sure do have a lot in common.  Hope for in common benign results, too. It is actually gorgeous here tonight--Omaha, NE--went on a few errands.  My daughter also had indoor soccer practice and went to watch for just a bit.  Trying to be a little normal.  We are going to watch a movie and I am going to try to eat a little something.  I have to eat, even though it has been rough go of that. Love, Danielle
Posts.Title: I am so FRUSTRATED hoping42 JerzeeGurl43012

Posts.Content: hoping42 wrote: Okayt, First of all I am trying to feel optimisitic and positive about the ultimate results after my biopsy Tuesday.  Again, they are doing a stereotactic needle biopsy for new microcalcifications.  I so wish I had the report, I don't.  My mom seems to remember them showing that they were clustered in some way?  My brain went fuzzy, just remember they look like grains of salt, suspicious and biopsy recommended.  Birads 4.  New from last year and only on the left. My questions are a few, so bear with me. 1.  I think one of the reasons I am freaking out so bad is that I called my gynocologist's office in mid-December to tell them that I had some real itching and a tiny bit of discharge from what appeared from a crack in my nipple or a scap I scraped off?  They said try some cortisone creams and if it didn't help to let them know and they would call in a perscription.  Well, it did improve.  But, still there--left nipple only.  It almost looks like I can see a "hole" with tiny creases in the shaped of an astric with a tiny full red circle all around it.  It also appears a little flatter acorss the top compared to the other one, but not inverted.  I also experience a little tingling especially when putting something on it.  The "cut" has healed to that smaller hole. Nothing on the aereola seems different.  The thing is is that the calcifications they found by digital mammography (screening) were not found under my nipple but the upper outer left quadrant, but to be honest I remember them putting that cone piece of that machine more in the upper left inner but maybe that is just how it felt because it was flatened so much.  Anyway, if this and again IF is cancerous is there anyway that this could have started from this nipple?  Do you think the radiologist would have noticed if there was something uncommon with my nipple when he was doing the ultrasound which again was on the upper left quadrant and under my arm?  2.  Due to the advice of some wonderful people here-I am calling my gyno tomorrow to ask for a prescription to be called in in attempt to calm a bit before the biopsy.   Do you think that I can ask them to order a punch skin biopsy to check for Paget's as long as I will be numb and have such concerns about the changes in my nipple?  I am hoping that the nipple itchiness, etc. is just a coincidence of winter skin and I will still get a benign result.  I just want to ask what you ladies think. 3.  I am not doing the Dr. Google thing as told by the wise ladies here--but it is hard, but I did when I first noticed the change in my nipple.  I guess I was glad that it was responding with over the counter stuff and figured that if something was wrong they would be able to tell by the mammogram---but I guess that is not always the case.   4.  Does anyone else feel like the can feel their breasts every minute? Thank you!  Again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Danielle Dx 1/19/2013, DCIS, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 2/4/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Dx 2/8/2013, Paget's, <1cm, Stage 0, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 2/20/2013 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 5/29/2013 Reconstruction (right) Surgery 5/29/2013 Reconstruction (left) Surgery 12/12/2013 Reconstruction (left): Nipple reconstruction; Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction Log in to post a reply

Danielle

Posts.Title: New questions on Sunday hoping42 GramM

Posts.Content: hoping42 wrote: Hello, everyone.  I am 42 years old and have been having routine mammogram's for the last 4 years, with a base line at 35.  The last one (last Thursday) showed that I have microcalcifications that warrant a diagnostic mammogram and an ultrasound.  My mom will be with me.  (She is a bc survivor!!!).  I am scared out of my mind!  The report says (as read back to me) that there is no interval changes, no distortion, no masses, but new microcalcificationsin the left outer upper breast.  I know that 'micro' can be the "bad" kind vs. 'macro'.  I also had called my ob/gyn a few weeks back because I had terrible itching, cracking etc. on my nipple (also left)--they didn't seem concerned and they still don't think it is related because the microcalcifications (as you all know there is nothing micro about being monumentally scared) is in the outer upper breast-by arm pit I guess instead of under the nipple or something?  This has seemed to have gotten much better with neosporin and cortisone 10-- Just mentioning because it is adding to my fears with it being the left side.  I guess I am just wondering if my sick to my gut feeling is warranted or could subside a bit.  I forgot to mention that I have my follow up this Thursday morning.  It is my understanding that the radiologist will meet with me before I leave.  Does this mean they are overly suspicious or concerned?  Thank you for any and all encouragement and reality comments.  It is much, much appreciated.  God bless. Dx 1/19/2013, DCIS, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 2/4/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Dx 2/8/2013, Paget's, <1cm, Stage 0, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 2/20/2013 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 5/29/2013 Reconstruction (right) Surgery 5/29/2013 Reconstruction (left) Surgery 12/12/2013 Reconstruction (left): Nipple reconstruction; Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Please help! hoping42 hoping42

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2013 11:31PM hoping42 wrote: Hi Annette.  They are recommending a biopsy which I will have done next Tuesday.  The radiologist did say that there is no mass detected by the magnified mammo or the ultrasound.  His words were that's "good, very good".  I was also a trembling mess, tears and all when I was having the ultrasound done.  Gosh, the last time I had one of those was one of the happiest days of my life---finding out if my beautiful was going to be a girl or a boy.  She is 11.  I am just so scared.  I did ask the radiologist what the next step would be IF they are and he said bilateral mri, then a lumpectomy or mastectomy.  I don't think he would have gone there if I had not asked but I did.  You seem very strong and your words are encouraging.  Thank you!
Posts.Title: Please help! hoping42 hoping42

Posts.Content: hoping42 wrote: Another night of basically no sleep.  As I have posted, I go for the biopsy next Tuesday.   There are no microcalcifications in the right breast.  Is there still a chance that my biopsy could be benign when the concern is only in my left breast?  This question is what is currently causing such worry--at this moment.  Thank you everyone! ALSO... I am a teacher.  I love my job, just so tired and hope I can keep a smile and stay "myself" so the kids don't know there is something going on.  My 11 year old asked me last night what was so wrong.  I guess I didn't do such a hot job hiding my fears and tears from her.  My husband and I talked with her just a little bit.  She saw grandma go through so much.  (but my mom is healthy survivor and my hero) and this scares her.  Just sharing. It's hard to be normal when you're waiting to hear you are normal. I wish all well and thank you for being so welcoming and supportive.
